page.title: 07WILD-LIFE
page.content: Because this is an area of traditional farming with relatively little pollution and destruction of the countryside, wild life is abundant. Some of the species more commonly observed include deer, rabbit, hare, pheasant, buzzard, salmon and trout. Members of the local community have varied interests in wild-life - there are active conservation groups as well as poachers and fox hunters! Wild mink and heron are considered nuisances by fishermen. One local character interviewed described how he trapped mink and then put his gun through the bars of the cage. As the mink grabbed the end of the gun with its mouth he shot it. This same man has a badgers' set above his house which is regularly observed by a conservationist.
